PRINCIPLE DESIGNER / OWNER
Professional Summary
Interior Designer with a distinct understanding of spatial theory who harbors an exceptional design instinct and is uniquely attuned to the importance of materiality, lighting, composition and the overall design process.
Core Qualifications
Drafting
Space planning
Interior architectural detailing Color and material application
Proficient with furniture systems
Concept development
Proficient in AutoCAD Graphic presentations Product specifications

SKILLS

3D, Approach, Art, AGENCY, AutoCAD, Basic, budgets, budget, Color, Concept, Concept development, content, Council, client, clients, direction, documentation, Drafting, fast, floor plans, Graphic, HVAC, Instructor, interior
design, Interior Design, Lighting, access, Window, Plumbing, presentations, Design Process, Space planning, specification, Teaching, vision, written

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Lighting Designer and Project Manager for David A Mintz Inc., a former May Company consulting firm.
Developed and designed all lighting for Robinson — May , Fashion Valley Mall and Foley's, Scottsdale Fashion Square Mall.
Assisted in the development and design of various Hecht's, Kaufmann's, Strawbridge's, and Lord and Taylor department store lighting, while simultaneously completing and meeting all deadlines for several large-scale successful projects.
Successfully completing graduate school by I writing thesis underlining the theoretical concept of spatial theory.

EXPERIENCE


08/2011 to Current
Principle Designer / Owner
Company Name
— City , State
Designed floor plans, elevations, and 3D perspective views and material boards for both in-house review and presentation to the client.
Programmed client's need from schematic design to the construction document phase and installation.
Created professional presentations to creatively communicate design intent and direction.
Participated in furniture selection and documentation of the specifications.
Maintained accurate specifications for each project.
Ensured that the project vision and design intent were reflected.
Visited home sites when necessary to assess and fulfill customer needs.
Successfully assisted clients in choosing furnishings that were consistent with their preferences and budget.
Produced content for material boards and specification binders for presentation and construction.
Reviewed project costs, budgets and adherence to schedules.

Designed floor plans, elevations,and material boards for both in-house review and presentation to the client.

Electrical (Power & Lighting), Plumbing, Sprinklers. and some HVAC.

Primarily assigned to remodels do to their more complicated nature.
Designed floor plans, elevations and created professional presentations to creatively communicate design intent and direction.
Maintained accurate specifications for each project.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Graphic Designer

Location: Casa Grande, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
Maricopa, AZ 

Competitive Pay And Benefits

 The Graphic Designer  will play a pivotal role in enhancing our brand identity and communicating our message effectively to our target audience. You will collaborate closely with the marketing team and other departments to create visually compelling designs that align with our brand guidelines and objectives.

Graphic Designer Responsibilities

 Develop creative concepts, graphics, and layouts for various marketing materials, including brochures, product packaging, advertisements, and digital media.  Design and produce visual content for print and digital platforms, ensuring consistency in branding and messaging.  Collaborate with the marketing team to brainstorm ideas, storyboard concepts, and contribute innovative solutions to marketing campaigns.  Create visually engaging presentations for internal and external stakeholders, including sales presentations, trade show materials, and corporate communications.  Maintain and update the company's visual assets, including logos, images, and templates, to ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints.  Stay up-to-date with industry trends, design tools, and best practices to continuously improve the quality and effectiveness of our designs.  Manage multiple projects simultaneously and adhere to deadlines while maintaining high standards of quality and accuracy.  Work closely with external vendors, printers, and other suppliers to oversee the production process and ensure the final output meets our specifications. 

Graphic Designer Requirements

 High School Diploma or GED required.  Degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communications, or related field preferred  Proven experience as a graphic designer, preferably in a manufacturing or industrial setting.  Proficiency in graphic design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).  Strong understanding of typography, color theory, layout design, and visual composition.  Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.  Detail-oriented with a keen eye for aesthetics and a passion for creativity.  Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.  Portfolio showcasing a diverse range of design projects, with an emphasis on print and digital media.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
